Through his belief in the power of community & unwavering commitment to radical love and justice, Mel King transformed the City of Boston and our nation.

We are all better for having known, loved & learned from him & his belief in what‚Äôs possible.

Rest in Power, Mel King.

Of reading Chain of Change early in my career, which changed my worldview & approach to movement building.

Of his wife Joyce & their beautiful family, & of his lessons in love, as a husband, father, legislator, professor, writer, trailblazer, a brilliant yet humble, KING.

Today, as we feel the grief of his absence, I‚Äôm thinking of his sharp intellect & wit, his poetry readings & community brunches.

Of his deep belief in the power of our youth & dedication to cultivating their leadership & centering their voices.

He blazed trails & pushed boundaries, advocating for tenants rights, housing justice, food security, technology, the arts.

He challenged convention, wearing dashikis in the State House & overalls in rarefied rooms.
